Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2008 11:56AM gloriakey wrote: Questions Anyone, When reading entries from people.......nearly everyone had problems with the "left breast".  That is my problem also.  Is this just my imagination or is the left breast more prone to having cancer problems??? Just curious, Gloria
Posts.Title: Very Angry! LisaG42 BessB

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2008 11:53AM gloriakey wrote: Hi, I'm sorry to hear that there are such "stupid, insensitive people out there".  It is nice to know that a person can find a website to vent at, though. Just returned from a repeat mammo with magnification on my left breast, due to "clustered calcifications".  I've been reading some messages and had no idea that calcifications could be next step to breast cancer.  I'll be awaiting the repeat mammo results with much anxiousness.  I was glad to hear that 80% of the women with this diagnosis are negative for cancer.  Can anyone point me to where I can get more info on "clustered calcifications".  Thanks for being here. Sincerely, Gloria
